extends java.lang.Object

      The Customer object holds all the relevant data of a single customer.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Customer

        public Customer(java.lang.String _code,
                java.lang.String _firstName,
                java.lang.String _lastName,
                java.lang.String _flightCode,
                boolean _booked,
                float _weight,
                float _volume)
         throws exceptions.InvalidValueException
        The Customer object holds all the relevant data of a single customer.
        Parameters:
        _code - customer's unique reference code
        _firstName - customer's first name
        _lastName - customer's last name
        _flightCode - flight code unique to each individual flight
        _booked - has the customer been checked in yet
        _weight - weight of the customer's baggage
        _volume - volume of the customer's baggage
        Throws:
        exceptions.InvalidValueException - when any of the input values are either empty, null or if the integer values are below zero

    • Method Detail

      • setCheckedIn

        public void setCheckedIn(float _weight,
                         float _volume)
                  throws exceptions.AlreadyCheckedInException,
                         exceptions.InvalidValueException
        Checks in the customer and sets their baggage weight and volume values.
        Parameters:
        _weight - weight of the customer's baggage
        _volume - volume of the customer's baggage
        Throws:
        exceptions.AlreadyCheckedInException - if the customer has already been checked into the system
        exceptions.InvalidValueException - if the input weight or volume values are invalid (similar to the customer constructor check)

      • isCheckedIn

        public boolean isCheckedIn()
        Returns:
        if the customer has been booked in yet
